title: Ticket #7531: box_plugin doesn't work for uploads > 50 MB
description:
Users cannot upload files greater than 50 MB using the Box file transfer plugin as Box is now (since when?) is enforcing chunked uploads for such files.

https://developer.box.com/guides/uploads/chunked/
remarks:
2020-Mar-03 15:22:56 by jpatton:
Resolved in [59075], tested in CHTC using custom file transfer plugins (woo!). Feel free to run the test yourself:

generate_files.sh 

#!/bin/bash

dd if=/dev/urandom of=$PWD/10mb.bin count=10000 bs=1000
dd if=/dev/urandom of=$PWD/60mb.bin count=60000 bs=1000

test_box_plugin.submit 

executable = generate_files.sh

use_oauth_services = box
transfer_plugins = box=box_plugin.py
transfer_output_remaps = "10mb.bin = box://plugin test/10mb.bin; 60mb.bin = box://plugin test/60mb.bin"

output = out
log = log

queue

2020-Mar-03 15:26:28 by jpatton:
And here's the transfer_history from my test. Note the different TransferUrl for the different upload methods. Also, sadly, note the difference in upload times... chunked upload takes much longer, though (according to the API docs) we could attempt to upload a few chunks at a time in parallel.

TransferProtocol = "https"
TransferStartTime = 1583269943
TransferSuccess = true
